response.original_title: Norman Granz’ Jazz in Montreaux presents Tommy Flanagan Trio ’77
response.overview: Tommy Flanagan is renowned for his flawless and stylish playing, which made him the accompanist of choice for many, most especially Ella Fitzgerald. This 1977 concert sees him performing in his own right as the leader of his trio, with Keeter Betts on bass and Bobby Durham on drums.
response.title: Norman Granz’ Jazz in Montreaux presents Tommy Flanagan Trio ’77
